designScenario.name: Rudder
designScenario.description: The Rudder system provides directional stability and yaw control through aerodynamic force modulation. It integrates adaptive response algorithms, redundant actuation, and real-time health monitoring to ensure reliability in extreme flight conditions. Designed for next-generation aircraft, it emphasizes AI-assisted control surface optimization, reduced mechanical hysteresis, and compatibility with hybrid-electric propulsion systems.

details.description: Execute pilot/FCS (Flight Control System) commands via fly-by-wire interfaces with variable deflection ratios based on airspeed and altitude.
Compensate for asymmetric thrust scenarios during engine-out emergencies through coordinated rudder-throttle control logic.
Achieve full authorized deflection (±30°) within 40ms at 500kt airspeed, maintaining phase margin >45° in control loop.
Limit transient overshoot to <5% of commanded position during high-rate maneuvers (≥15°/sec).
Implement triple-redundant electro-hydrostatic actuators with force-fight resolution circuitry.
Integrate strain gauge arrays for real-time load monitoring, triggering automatic load shedding at 120% design limit load.
Enable in-situ composite repair via embedded conductive threads for lightning strike protection system integrity checks.
Design hinge assemblies for 100,000+ flight cycles without lubrication under ICAO Annex 16 Chapter 14 noise constraints.

systemComponents.name: Smart Rudder Assembly
systemComponents.description: Primary aerodynamic surface with embedded shape memory alloy tabs for boundary layer control.

subComponents.name: Carbon-Nanotube Reinforced Spar
subComponents.description: Main load-bearing element with 2200 MPa compressive strength and embedded fiber-optic strain sensors.

subComponents.name: Morphing Trailing Edge
subComponents.description: Electroactive polymer-actuated trailing edge for continuous camber adjustment (±8°).

systemComponents.name: Dual-Mode Actuator System
systemComponents.description: Hybrid electromechanical/hydraulic actuation package with <2ms control latency.

subComponents.name: BLDC Torque Motor
subComponents.description: 400Nm direct-drive motor with Halbach array permanent magnets for fault-tolerant operation.

subComponents.name: Electro-Rheraulic Backup
subComponents.description: Self-contained ER fluid system with 3000psi working pressure for degraded mode operation.

systemComponents.name: Rudder Health Monitoring Pod
systemComponents.description: Edge-computing unit analyzing actuator current signatures and vibration spectra for predictive maintenance.

relationships.description: Receives ARINC 664p-7 commands from FCC for surface positioning with 10ms time-triggered updates.
Structurally integrated to vertical stabilizer torsion box via fail-safe hinge fittings with 2.5x FoS.
Streams prognostic data via AFDX to central maintenance computer for fleet-wide trend analysis.
Draws backup power from RAT-driven 270VDC bus during primary electrical system failure.

attributes.name: hingeMomentCapacity
attributes.description: Maximum sustainable hinge moment at never-exceed speed with 150% ultimate load factor.

attributes.name: harmonicDistortion
attributes.description: Maximum allowable current harmonic distortion in actuator drive signals to prevent EMI in fly-by-wire systems.

attributes.name: thermalStability
attributes.description: Maintain deflection accuracy across temperature extremes encountered during high-altitude/high-Mach flight.

attributes.name: flutterMargin
attributes.description: Certified flutter-free operation up to 125% of dive flutter speed (Vdf) with 15% mass balance.

attributes.name: EMI Shielding
attributes.description: Faraday cage protection for actuator electronics against HIRF/lightning strike induced currents.

comments.body: Maximum deflection angle constrained to ±30 degrees
